text: Richard Anthony Allen (March 8, 1942 â€“ December 7, 2020) was an American professional baseball player. During his 15-season Major League Baseball (MLB) career, he appeared as a first baseman, third baseman, and outfielder. He played for the Philadelphia Phillies, St. Louis Cardinals, Los Angeles Dodgers, Oakland Athletics and Chicago White Sox. Allen was born in Wampum, Pennsylvania. == Candidacy == He was going to get into the hall of fame, but he died before he could make it. So sad. == Death == Allen died on December 7, 2020 in Wampum from cancer at the age of 78. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Pennsylvania Category:Philadelphia Phillies players Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:Oakland Athletics players Category:Chicago White Sox players Category:Sportspeople from Pennsylvania
